docs.description: The Current Employment Statistics Program provides employment, paid hours, and earnings information on a national basis in considerable industrial detail.  The Bureau of Labor Statistics collects data each month from a sample of establishments in all nonfarm activities including government.

docs.name: Commodity Exports - Optical, Photo, Technical, Medical, Etc Apparatus / Navigational instruments and appliances nes - Estonia
docs.description: The United Nations Commodity Trade Statistics Database (UN Comtrade) stores more than 1 billion trade data records from 1962. Over 140 reporter countries provide the United Nations Statistics Division with their annual international trade statistics detailed by commodities and partner countries. These data are subsequently transformed into the United Nations Statistics Division standard format with consistent coding and valuation using the UN/OECD CoprA internal processing system.

docs.name: Cape Verde: % of firms that foreign supplies or major inputs
docs.description:
To gauge trade conditions, this indicator calculates the percentage of firms that use material inputs and/or supplies of foreign origin. The results are based on surveys of more than 100,000 firms in 125 countries--except in 2006 and 2007, when this indicator was computed for the Manufacturing Module of the survey only. Source: World Bank, Enterprise Surveys (http://www.enterprisesurveys.org/ExploreTopics/?topicid=10).
% of firms that foreign supplies or major inputs
